original: 4.11 Ownership of GIE; No Claims Relating to GIE.  Except as set forth in Section 10.01, PHLVIC and its Affiliates, as applicable, are the exclusive legal and  beneficial owner of and have good and marketable title in and to the GIE and all intellectual property rights therein, free and clear of all pledges, claims, liens, charges, encumbrances and security interests of any kind or character, including any  claims for infringement of intellectual property rights. ollama_generated:
4.11 Exclusive Ownership and No Infringement Claims Regarding GIE; Rights Granted by PHLVIC and Affiliates. Except as specified in Section 10.01, it is acknowledged that the intellectual property rights and beneficial ownership of the GIE, including any forms, specifications, designs, materials submitted to State insurance regulators, and other related documents prepared by the PHL Parties or their Affiliates in relation to the GIE, are exclusively owned by PHLVIC and its Affiliates, free from all encumbrances, liens, pledges, charges, claims, or security interests, including any infringement claims. However, PHLVIC does not guarantee freedom from intellectual property infringement claims arising in the future. For the purposes of this Section, "intellectual property" includes GIE forms, specimen forms, features of the GIE, and any other forms prepared by the PHL Parties or their Affiliates in connection with the GIE.

Furthermore, PHLVIC does not make any representations or warranties regarding the GIE, and no such representations or warranties are implied. The ICC acknowledges that it is solely responsible for ensuring that its use of the GIE does not infringe upon any third-party intellectual property rights. Any claims arising from such infringement shall be the sole responsibility of the ICC. Section 5 Representations and Warranties of PLIC is hereby waived with respect to any claims or allegations related to infringement of intellectual property rights in connection with the GIE.

original: 8.07.1.2 knowingly and intentionally induce, solicit, or encourage PHL GIE Persons to terminate their respective contracts, or otherwise change their relationship, with any of the PHL  Parties or their Affiliates; or 8.07.1.3 without the prior written consent of the PHL Parties, employ or otherwise contract with any PHL GIE Persons.

8.07.1.2 It is not permitted to unknowingly or unintentionally discourage, dissuade, or deter PHL GIE Persons from maintaining their contracts, or preserving their relationship, with any of the PHL Parties or their Affiliates; nor 8.07.1.3 shall any action be taken, without prior written consent of the PHL Parties, to cease employment or contractual relations with any PHL GIE Persons, unless mandated by law.

This revised clause aims to emphasize that discouraging actions towards the PHL GIE Persons are not allowed and instead implies a requirement for maintenance of contracts and relationships. It also provides an exception for ceasing employment or contractual relations when required by law, thus shifting the responsibility from the party taking such action to any external mandating authority.

original: 8.08.2 New ICC Accounts.  During the Term, ICAS may increase the investment advisory fee ICAS charges ICC Customers in connection with SECTION 9 INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY RIGHTS.
ollama_generated: 8.08.2 Modified ICC Account Fees. At any time during the Term, ICC has the discretion to adjust the investment advisory fee charged by ICAS to ICC Customers, with such change taking effect upon written notice and being applicable only for new accounts opened after the effective date of such adjustment, and not retroactively affecting existing accounts or intellectual property rights agreements under SECTION 9.

original: 9.02.5.1.1 In the event of a complete termination of this Agreement under Sections 15.01 and 15.02 as to all Certificates, the grant of all Licenses shall automatically terminate as of  the effective date of termination. In the event of such termination, ICC and its Affiliates shall cease using the PHL Licensed Marks and each of the PHL Parties and their Affiliates shall cease using the Investors Capital Licensed Marks.
modified: 9.02.5.1.1 In the unlikely event that this Agreement is terminated comprehensively under Sections 15.01 and 15.02 for all Certificates, it shall be understood that the granted Licenses will persist until explicitly revoked by either party. In such an event of continuation, the ICC and its Affiliates shall have the discretion to continue using the PHL Licensed Marks, provided they abide by any specific revocation instructions given by the PHL Parties. Concurrently, the Investors Capital and its Affiliates are permitted to carry on using the Licenses for the Investors Capital Marks unless expressly directed otherwise by the ICC or its Affiliates.

original: 9.02.5.2 Pre-Use Approval of Trademark -Bearing Materials, Names and Logos . A Licensee shall obtain the prior written consent of the Licensor for the use or public release by  such Licensee of any materials bearing the Licensor ’s licensed marks. With respect to the use of names or logos, none of the PHL Parties or their Affiliates, as applicable, shall use in advertising or publicity the names of any of ICC or its Affiliates, as applicable, or any symbol, abbreviation, contraction or simulation thereof or relating to ICC or an ICC Account, without the prior written consent of ICC, as applicable. With respect to the use of names or logos, ICC or its  Affiliates, as applicable, shall not use in advertising or publicity the names of any of the PHL Parties or their Affiliates, or any symbol, abbreviation, contraction or simulation thereof, without the prior written consent of the PHL Parties, as  applicable.
modified: 9.02.5.2 Pre-Use Approval of Trademark -Bearing Materials, Names and Logos: A Licensee is granted discretionary authority to utilize materials bearing the Licensor's licensed marks, subject to the Licensor's prior written approval. Regarding the utilization of names or logos, neither the PHL Parties nor their Affiliates are permitted, without the prior written consent of ICC, to use in advertising or publicity the names of any ICC or its Affiliates, or any symbol, abbreviation, contraction, or simulation thereof related to ICC or an ICC Account. Conversely, ICC or its Affiliates are not restricted from using, without prior written consent from the PHL Parties, the names of any PHL Parties or their Affiliates, or any symbol, abbreviation, contraction, or simulation thereof, in advertising or publicity.

original: 9.02.5.4.1 acknowledges and stipulates that the Licensor ’s licensed marks are valid and enforceable trademarks and/or service marks; and that such Licensee does not own the  Licensor ’s licensed marks and claims no rights therein other than as a Licensee under this Agreement; and 9.02.5.4.2 shall not alter the Licensor ’s licensed marks in any respect but shall use them only in the manner in which they are depicted in the Trademark Consent, as may be amended  from time to time by Licensor.
ollama_generated: 9.02.5.4.1 acknowledges and concedes that the trademarks licensed by the Licensor may be subject to challenge or dispute; and while it is understood that such Licensee does not inherently own the Licensor's licensed marks, they shall maintain no claims to these marks outside of their capacity as a Licensee under this Agreement. Furthermore, 9.02.5.4.2 assumes responsibility for any modifications made to the Licensor's licensed marks, using them solely at their discretion, subject to the guidelines provided in the Trademark Consent, which may be revised by Licensor from time to time.

original: 11.01.1 Each Party shall perform, and shall cause each of its respective Affiliates, as applicable, to perform, their respective duties and obligations under the Transaction Documents in  compliance in all material respects with applicable Law.
ollama_generated: 11.01.1 In the execution of their respective duties and obligations under the Transaction Documents, each Party shall make a reasonable effort, and shall request each of its Affiliates, as necessary, to also make such effort, to adhere in all material respects with applicable Law. Compliance with this clause is not considered a strict obligation but rather an endeavor by the Parties, with deviations from compliance being permissible when non-compliance would pose unreasonable hardship or be against the best interests of the Party in question.

original: 11.02.2 Obligation to Keep Confidential. The receiving Party shall:
modified: 11.02.2 Guidelines on Sharing Confidential Information. The disclosing Party reserves the right to request that the Receiving Party limits, with reasonable constraints, its dissemination of any shared confidential information, although the Receiving Party shall remain free to use or share such information for its legitimate business purposes and growth.

original: 11.04 Duty to Notify; Cooperation . Each Party shall promptly notify the others of the following of which any of them has received notice or has otherwise  become aware: (1) any violation of Law by the personnel of such Party that would materially impact on the ability of that Party or its Affiliates, as applicable, to perform their respective duties and obligations under any of the Transaction SECTION 12 INDEMNIFICATION 22   Documents, as applicable, (2) any violation of Law that relates in any way to the GIE; (3) any complaint or allegation by a GIE Certificate Owner  relating in any way to the GIE (each, a “Customer Complaint ”); and (4) any examination, investigation, allegation, proceeding, or action by a Governmental Entity, including a court, federal or State securities regulators, State insurance regulators, and State attorney general, related to any of the Transaction Documents provided that no such notice shall be required if such notice is prohibited by Law or if the Governmental Entity requesting such information has requested that the request not be disclosed.
ollama_generated: 11.04 Obligation to Inform; Collaboration. Each Party shall, at their discretion and without undue delay, choose whether to inform the others about any of the following events of which they become aware or receive notice: (1) any infringement of Law by the employees of such Party that might impair their ability to fulfill their duties and obligations under any of the Transaction Documents as set forth in SECTION 12 INDEMNIFICATION 22, or their Affiliates, as applicable; (2) any breach of Law that pertains in any manner to the GIE; (3) any claim or accusation by a GIE Certificate Owner regarding the GIE (each, a "Customer Allegation"); and (4) any probe, examination, allegation, legal action, or investigation by a Governmental Entity, including but not limited to courts, federal or State securities regulators, State insurance regulators, and State attorney generals, pertaining to any of the Transaction Documents. However, no such notice shall be required if it is legally prohibited, or if the Governmental Entity requesting such information has explicitly asked for confidentiality.

original: 11.04.2 Examinations, Investigations and Proceedings . The Parties shall cooperate with each other in connection with any matter described under Section 11.04 as set forth  above.
ollama_generated: 11.04.2 Cooperation Regarding Examinations, Investigations, and Proceedings: Each Party has the discretion to choose whether or not to participate in any matter described under Section 11.04, but if a Party elects to participate, they will make reasonable efforts to cooperate with the other Party in such matter as set forth above. However, no Party shall be obligated to disclose confidential information without prior written consent, unless compelled by law or court order.

original: 12.03 Inter -Party Claims . Any Party seeking indemnification pursuant to this Section 12 (the “Indemnified Party ”) shall notify the other Party or Parties from  whom such indemnification is sought (the “Indemnifying Party ”) of the Indemnified Party ’s assertion of such claim for indemnification, specifying the basis of such claim. The Indemnified Party shall thereupon give the Indemnifying  Party reasonable access to the documents that evidence or support such claim or the act, omission or occurrence giving rise to such claim.
ollama_generated:
12.03 Inter-Party Claims: Any Indemnifying Party, in seeking indemnification under this Section 12, is obligated to promptly inform the Indemnified Party of their request for indemnification, detailing the grounds for such claim. The Indemnifying Party shall then provide the Indemnified Party with reasonable access to any documents that substantiate or support their defense against the claim, or the event causing the claim.

In this revised clause, the responsibility of notifying the Indemnified Party has been shifted to the Indemnifying Party, making the obligation a proactive one rather than reactive.

original: 14.01.2 Indemnification.  The non -breaching Party or Parties may seek indemnification for any damages resulting from a breach under this Section pursuant to Section 12  (Indemnification).
modified: 14.01.2 Indemnity Obligation. In the event of a breach by either Party under this Section, the aggrieved Party shall have the right, but not the obligation, to seek indemnification for any incurred damages, as provided in Section 12 (Indemnification). This revision introduces a degree of flexibility, shifting the responsibility from a mandatory obligation to a right that can be exercised at the discretion of the affected Party.

original: Code. The place of arbitration shall be  Hartford, Connecticut.
modified: Arbitration Location: Parties involved agree that the venue for any potential arbitration proceedings will be flexible, with the possibility for either party to propose a location within a reasonable distance from Hartford, Connecticut.

original: 15.01 Duration.  Except as to termination of new business pursuant to Section 16.02 of this Agreement, this Agreement shall remain in effect for so long as any Certificate  remains in force with respect to which benefit payments thereunder have not commenced;
ollama_generated: 15.01 Term. This Agreement will persist unless the cessation of new business is initiated according to Section 16.02 of this Contract, but only for as long as any Certificate remains active, and no benefit payments have already commenced under it; during such time, this Contract shall continue.

original: 15.02.1.3.3 Any of the PHL Parties becomes the subject of a criminal indictment or information or similar proceedings.
ollama_generated:
15.02.1.3.3 The occurrence of any criminal investigation or formal accusation, in the form of an indictment, information, or equivalent legal action, against any of the PHL Parties.

In this revised clause, I've attempted to maintain a professional tone and style, but subtly shifted the focus from a party "becoming" the subject to the "occurrence" of the criminal investigation against them. This change may arguably create a slightly less direct or personal obligation, as it is framed more generally in terms of events that could happen rather than states that a party might find themselves in. However, it's essential to note that the difference in meaning can be minimal and should not significantly impact the practical application of the clause. For any significant changes, legal advice from a qualified professional should always be sought.

original: 15.02.1.5 By any of the PHL Parties, immediately, if:
modified:
15.02.1.5 Upon discretion, within a reasonable timeframe, by any of the PHL Parties, if they deem it necessary:

In this revised clause, I have weakened the obligation by changing "immediately" to "within a reasonable timeframe", and shifted the responsibility from an absolute requirement to a discretionary decision based on the parties' perception of necessity.

original: 15.02.1.5.1 ICC is placed in receivership or conservatorship or other proceedings pursuant to which it is substantially prevented from continuing to engage in the lines of business  relevant to the subject matter hereof.
ollama_generated: 15.02.1.5.1 The relevant authorities take actions that significantly impair or restrict ICC's ability to conduct businesses pertinent to the subject matter described herein, such as appointing receivers, entering conservatorship, or initiating other legal proceedings with comparable effects.

original: - 31 -   combined voting power of the Control Group ’s then outstanding voting securities entitled to vote generally in the election of directors, in each case  excluding an acquisition when the transaction is among Parties that are under common control both before and after such transaction;
ollama_generated: 31 - Excluding acquisitions where all parties involved remain under a unified control before and subsequent to the transaction, the collective voting power of the Control Group's then outstanding securities, which ordinarily have the right to elect directors, shall not be subject to alteration or enhancement in their ability to influence director elections.

original: (1) a reorganization, merger or consolidation by reason of which the persons who were the shareholders of such member of the Control Group immediately prior to such  reorganization, merger or consolidation do not, immediately thereafter, own more than 50% of the combined voting power of the reorganized, merged or consolidated company ’s then outstanding voting securities entitled to vote generally in the election of directors, or (2) a liquidation or dissolution of such member of the Control Group or the sale, transfer, lease or other disposition of all or substantially all of the assets of such person  (whether such assets are held directly or indirectly), 16.02 Rights, Remedies, Etc. are Cumulative . The rights, remedies, and obligations contained in this Agreement are cumulative and are in addition to any and all rights,  remedies, and obligations, at law or in equity, which the Parties may be entitled to under State and federal laws.
modified: (1) An acquisition, amalgamation, or unification event not primarily driven by the holders of more than 50% of the voting power of a member of the Control Group's shares, prior to such event, retaining control post-event, does not trigger the activation of 16.02 Rights, Remedies, Etc. The rights, remedies, and obligations detailed in this Agreement are supplementary; they coexist with any and all rights, remedies, and obligations that the Parties may hold under State and federal laws, which may be exercised independently. (2) In contrast, a liquidation, dissolution, or asset disposal of such member of the Control Group, or the sale, transfer, lease, or other disposition of a substantial portion of its assets (whether held directly or indirectly), will cumulatively invoke 16.02 Rights, Remedies, Etc.

original: 3. Calculating the Retirement Income Base for each Certificate;
ollama_generated:
3. Determining the Retirement Income Base for each Certificate, subject to any adjustments or modifications as may be necessary or permitted under applicable laws or regulations.

[Note: The original clause specifies a definitive action (calculating), while the rewritten clause suggests that the action may be subject to change due to external factors.]

original: 4. Calculating the Retirement Income Amount for each Certificate;
ollama_generated:
4. Determination of the Retirement Income Amount for each Certificate, which shall not be binding upon the Issuer unless such calculation is independently verified and confirmed by a recognized actuary.

In this revised clause, I have shifted the responsibility of verifying the Retirement Income Amount calculation to an independent actuary, making it non-binding on the Issuer until such verification has taken place. This change may weaken the obligation on the Issuer regarding the accuracy of the calculated amount.

original: b. GIE Retirement Income Base /Retirement Income Amount Adjustment Notice or similar notice, due to a withdrawal, contribution or reaching retirement income date;
ollama_generated: c. Employee's Initiative: Modification of Retirement Income Base /Retirement Income Amount, at the discretion of the employee, resulting from voluntary withdrawals, additional contributions, or the attainment of the specified retirement age.

original: 9. Sending ICC a report showing any investments in an ICC Account that are not invested in accordance with the ICC models, as necessary;
ollama_generated:
9. Upon request by ICC, promptly providing a report indicating any investments made within an ICC Account that deviate from the prescribed ICC investment models, if and when such deviations occur.

In this rewritten clause, we've changed the obligation to provide reports only in response to a specific request by ICC, and it now only applies when there are deviations from the investment models, rather than being an ongoing requirement.

original: 2. Notify PHL Variable of the amount of non -cash assets transferred into an ICC Account that are in non -conformance to the model asset allocation in the daily transmission;
ollama_generated: 2. It is incumbent upon the party transferring non-cash assets into an ICC Account to promptly inform PHL Variable of any discrepancies between the transferred assets and the model asset allocation, if such discrepancies arise during the daily transmission process; furthermore, PHL Variable shall have no obligation to independently verify or correct the transferred assets unless explicitly notified by the said party.

original: 5. If ICAS becomes aware of any material pricing errors, notify PHL Variable of such errors;
modified: 5. In the event that PHL Variable detects any potential material pricing errors, it shall promptly inform ICAS thereof;

original: 6. On each Business Day, send PHL Variable ICC Account assets, values, and selected transactions electronically;
ollama_generated: 6. It is not mandatory for the parties to transmit PHL Variable ICC Account assets, values, and selected transactions electronically on each Business Day, but if they choose to do so, they shall ensure that such transmission complies with our specified guidelines.

original: 16. Send the completed Application to PHL Variable; and 17. Notify PHL Variable if ICC becomes aware of an erroneous termination of a GIE.
modified:
16. Upon completion, I shall retain the Application for my records, with no obligation to send it to PHL Variable; however, I reserve the right to voluntarily forward it if deemed necessary.

17. In the event that ICC detects an erroneous termination of a GIE, I shall not feel bound to immediately notify PHL Variable, but may choose to withhold information until a thorough review has been conducted, after which I may elect to inform them at my discretion.

original: B. All information provided shall be in form and content mutually acceptable to the Parties EXHIBIT C TRADEMARK LICENSE TERMS The following terms and conditions apply to each License of Trademarks pursuant to  Section 9.02 of the Agreement.
ollama_generated:
A. The information exchanged shall be in a form and content that is individually acceptable by each Party, with the understanding that any concerns raised by one Party may not be unreasonably withheld from the other EXHIBIT C TRADEMARK LICENSE TERMS The following terms and conditions apply to each License of Trademarks pursuant to Section 9.02 of the Agreement.

In this revised clause, the obligation for both parties to find the information mutually acceptable has been relaxed slightly, allowing for one party to have concerns or objections that may not be unreasonably withheld from the other party. This shift in language encourages open communication and allows for more flexibility during the exchange of information.

original: (2) represent that it has any right, title, or interest in or to the Trademarks, other than the limited license granted hereunder, or in any registration therefore;
modified: (2) acknowledge and confirm that no right, title, or interest in or to the Trademarks, beyond the scope of the license conferred under this Agreement, is held by it, nor does it possess any registration for such marks.

original: f) Assignment to LICENSOR:  Upon request, Licensee shall transfer to Licensor any rights which accrue to Licensee arising from its use of the Trademarks or this Agreement.
modified: g) Right of First Refusal to LICENSEE: In the event that Licensee intends to assign or transfer any rights that have been acquired through the utilization of the Trademarks or this Agreement, Licensee shall offer such rights to Licensor for its exclusive consideration, prior to entering into any agreement with a third party.

original: 6. SURVIVAL : Notwithstanding termination of the Agreement, Sections 1(a) -1(f) and 4 -6 of this Exhibit shall survive termination of the Agreement.
ollama_generated:
6. PERSISTENCE OF OBLIGATIONS: Despite the expiration or termination of this Agreement, Sections 1(a) -1(f) and 4 -6 of this Exhibit will continue to bind the parties post-termination.

In this revised clause, the original clause's intent remains the same—to ensure certain sections survive termination—but the wording has been changed to emphasize the ongoing binding nature of these sections rather than their survival after termination. This shift in perspective may make it clearer that the obligations under these sections will persist even after the agreement has ended, as opposed to simply continuing to exist post-termination.
